intro: Veronica mazanderanae, commonly known as Mazanderan speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from spring to summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
